reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife's and my expectations of a B & B come pretty high, and Morning Glory exceeds them all: charm, amenities, and overall cleanliness, site (within very short walking distance of everything) and the breakfast itself are all superb; even more important, however, are the courtesies and good coversation of the proprietors.
reviews.title: A Wonderful B & B Experience
Salem
reviews.text: This last comment - the courtesies and good conversation - may not be important to some, who tend to keep to themselves; to my wife and I, however, it is front and center, and tends to occur most frequently at the "breakfast" piece of "B & B". In this regard, Morning Glory is everything that I expect a B & B to be.

Beautiful. great service, walking distance to downtown, could see the house of 7 gables from the front door. the host was very knowledgeable about the history of the area, very near In A Pigs Eye pub, they had the best clam chowder i have ever had!!!
reviews.title: Recommended without reservation!

reviews.text: I have just returned from a delightful stay at the Morning Glory B&B over Thanksgiving weekend. The property is ideally situated within yards from Salem Harbor, immediately adjacent to the historically impressive House of the Seven Gables. The Morning Glory's welcoming ambience is true to this classic New England town. Immaculate in every detail, the interiors -- both common areas and en-suite rooms -- are beautifully appointed. (How often does one enjoy a working fireplace in their room!?)
reviews.title: Idyllic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The physical property is perfect, but its lasting charm is the result of the Innkeepers' personal regard for your comfort and enjoyment. Bob makes you feel at home right from the greeting on the front stoop. If you were born under a lucky star, your stay will include some of Marcel's cheese bread, lightly toasted with butter and a wedge of cheddar on the side. Delightful!
reviews.title: Romantic and delightful!

reviews.text: Bob was a very gracious and friendly host who made us feel at home as soon as we arrived. The rooms were very well appointed with a few surprises - your own fireplace and Hershey's kisses. Breakfast was very tasty with nearly all of it being homemade, we even got the recipe for the delicious granola to try ourselves. Overall, Morning Glory is deserving of it's no. 1 spot on Tripadvisor and long may it remain there!
reviews.title: Great place, great service, highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted shortly after our arrival by Bob Shea's Father who was watching the B&B while Bob Jr. and Marcel were away on a trip. Bob Sr, and his wife Mary Ann were very friendly and hospitable. We stayed in the Sarah Good Suite which was absolutely adorable! The room was very comfortable and offered a living area with a TV. We also had a private entrance off a deck that had a beautiful view of the bay. The deck is perfect to relax and drink a glass of wine! The location is in walking distance of anything you would want to see in Salem. We will definitely return to Salem and there is no doubt that we will stay at Morning Glory B&B again!!!
reviews.title: We have stayed at many B&B's and this one is our FAVORITE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Morning Glory is a great bed & breakfast in Salem. They have excellent rates, an outstanding location and wonderful rooms. Bob (the proprietor) is very nice and friendly and even picked us up from the commuter rail station when we got in to Salem. The rooms are very nice and they do have a no TV past 10pm policy which is nice (even though I usually watch TV until 1 or 2, it's a good considerate policy). They have an amazing top deck that would be lovely for breakfast during the summer.
reviews.title: Great B&B in heart of Salem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good with some great muffins and bread and wonderful service. We'll definitely by back when we visit Salem again!
reviews.title: BEST Bed and Breakfast in Salem MA area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Place was emaculate - great decor and a GREAT location. Bob made us feel at home for our three days in Salem. He bent over backwards for us, share recipies, gave perfect directions - all around perfect stay. The rooms were spacious and comfy. We stayed in the Sara Good room which is the whole third floor. Very nice accomidations with an excellant deck view of the harbor. It was also right next door to the House of Seven Gables if you want to visit the site.There is a computer and printer set up for guests, TV room and a delicious breakfast every morning.
reviews.title: Just as advertised

reviews.text: I stayed at the Morning Glory Bed and Breakfast with a friend of mine just to get away for the weekend and from the time we arrived to the time we left, Bob was great, so very nice. We stayed in the Elzabeth Howe room which was beautiful and very clean, and the bed omg soooooo comfortable it felt like I was sleeping on clouds. I can not remember the last time I slept so good and peaceful. We also had out our own entrance to the room which lead to a patio with beautiful views of the water. We've never been to a Bed and Breakfast so i really did not know wat to expect...but my experience was very good. This was also a last minute reservation we were going to stay at the Salem Inn and opted not to becasue of the mixed reviews, so we were very lucky to book a room at Morning Glory at the very last minute. The house is soo well kept, and not to mention Bob and Marcel's Cheese Bread we fell in love with it...we are still talking about it till this day!! Bob was kind enough to give us the recipe. we went sight seeing and ate at some very good resturants...but i will def. be coming back to the Morning Glory B&B... I came home and told everyone who would listen about how Great this place is...I even convinved a couple of ppl to look into it and book a room one wknd...Thanks Bob for everything, this was such a great experience!!!
reviews.title: OMG...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Morning Glory Bed & Breakfast is a very very enjoyable place to stay while visiting historic Salem. Bob and Marcel have done a wonderful job renovating a two family home into a beautiful bed & breakfast were all there guest can feel like it is there Home for their stay. Located just a short stroll from the wharf and all of Salem's attractions, it is definitely worth the stay. The rooms as well as the property are kept very clean. We stayed in the Sarah Good suite, which has its own private entrance from its private large balcony and a large comfortable bedroom with an extremely comfortable bed. The suite also includes a cozy living room. The furnishings and decorations are no different than I would place in my own home (could I afford them). The expanded continental breakfast was much more than expected, with homemade breads, coffee cake, and granola, as well as a fresh fruit cup, fresh orange juice and delicious coffee. We had the pleasure of enjoying our breakfast with Bob (one of the proprietors) who was like an old friend and very informative on local history and attractions. I'm sorry that we didn't get a chance to meet Marcel as I can imagine he is just as charming. This bed and breakfast will cost you slightly more than an average priced motel, but it is worth twice the cost. Thank you for welcoming us into your home and making us feel like family. We will be staying with you again.
reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMENDED

reviews.text: During my visit of the Salem Film Fest I stayed for three nights at the Morning Glory BB. The service was outstanding, the breakfast lovely. The Morning Glory combines the best of American hospitality.
reviews.title: The Best of American Hospitality

reviews.text: My stay was sooo wonderful! Thank you so much. I truly felt like I was staying with family. Bob made sure that if I needed anything, just to ask. He made me a pitcher of ice tea and had it waiting in the room when I arrived. The kitchen was freely available to me should I have needed anything in the middle of the night or day.
reviews.title: A warm welcome & I truly felt like I was staying with family.
